subject: Career
title: Eye Contact: The Trust Signal
description: A short lesson to help you apply Eye Contact: The Trust Signal.

hook.text: Too little eye contact signals dishonesty. Too much feels aggressive. The sweet spot is 60-70%.

buildup.text: Research shows moderate eye contact increases perceived trustworthiness and competence.

discovery.text: The trick: look at the interviewer while listening. You can break eye contact while thinking.

twist.text: In video interviews, look at the camera, not the screen. It simulates direct eye contact.

climax.text: Cultural norms vary â€” in some cultures, direct eye contact with elders is disrespectful.

punchline.text: Eye contact isn't staring. It's connecting.

quiz.question: What percentage of time should you maintain eye contact in interviews?
